name: Dwarf Cryptocoryne
description: Cryptocoryne parva is the smallest species in the Cryptocoryne genus, native to Sri Lanka. It features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are bright green and form dense rosettes. While it's primarily known as an aquatic plant for aquariums, it can also be grown emersed (above water) in high-humidity terrarium environments. When grown emersed, it forms a dense, grassy foreground that's perfect for terrariums. The plant is very slow-growing but eventually forms a beautiful carpet. It thrives in high humidity and can tolerate both submerged and emersed conditions.
careTips: Provide moderate to bright indirect light
Maintain very high humidity (80-95%) for emersed growth
Can grow emersed in high humidity or submerged
Fertilize regularly with root tabs or liquid fertilizer
